channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 30/08/25
item.content:encoded:
Regardless of what the weather does – and it’s been much windier and wetter the last few days – it’s the last few days of summer this weekend for families with children who have needed entertaining for past month and a half. It’s also the tipping point into a September that, as usual, is stuffed with some huge game releases!

In the News This Week

Unsurprisingly, it’s been a bit quieter this week than last, but there’s still been a good few announcements and reveals.

  • Skate early access release date has been confirmed for September 16th
  • Lumines Arise demo available now, full game releases November 11th
  • Destiny: Rising launches today and is pretty darn good on PC
  • Helldivers 2: Into the Unjust will launch on September 2nd
  • Funstock suspends new US orders due to suspension of de minimis exemption
  • Steam now needs your credit card details for UK OSA age checks
  • Space Marine 2 Year 2 roadmap revealed, as Black Templars drop into anniversary update
  • Ubisoft sell five old games to Atari
  • September 2025’s PS Plus games include Psychonauts 2

Games in Review & Featured Articles

It was a heavy week in the reviews column, but what stood out?

  • Shinobi: Art of Vengeance – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 9/10
  • SHUTEN ORDER – NSW, PC – 9/10
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land Switch 2 Edition + Star Crossed World – NSW2 – 9/10
  • The Rogue Prince of Persia – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • The Knightling – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar – NSW2, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Gears of War: Reloaded – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Fresh Tracks – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Dead Take – PC – 8/10
  • Herdling – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 7/10

Phew! How did we get all of those out the door? Well, alongside those, I had a bunch of Gamescom previews to deliver, including looks at Kirby Air Riders and Pokémon Legends: Z-A for Nintendo Switch 2.

I then turned my gaze to a pair of Saber Interactive’s upcoming games, with Turok: Origins looking to reviving the dino-blasting legend, and John Carpenter’s Toxic Commando having a grimey 80s zombie flick feel, blended with World War Z and RoadCraft.

I dipped into the arcade kart racing of Sonic Racing: Crossworld, clobbered through the superhero anime battling of My Hero Academia: All’s Justice, pinched and slapped the unique point & click Crushed in Time, and followed in the footsteps of the unique storytelling approach of Tides of Tomorrow.

There’s still tons of Gamescom previews for me to write up, so keep your eyes peeled.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Herdling, Shinobi: Art of Vengeance & The Rogue Prince of Persia.

Trailer Park

Wreckfest 2 Content Update 3 brings cars, tracks, better AI and more

Atomfall: The Red Strain DLC teased for September release

That’s the round up for this week’s round up, enjoy the weekend, and we’ll catch you for more gaming shenanigans next week!



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/30/something-for-the-weekend-30-08-25/

item.title: Destiny: Rising – How to get Bon Voyage Charms quickly
item.content:encoded:
Bon Voyage Charms and Bon Voyage Charms L.E. are the Gacha currency for NetEase’s new game, Destiny: Rising. In other words, these are what you need to use to unlock extra characters and other bonuses. As the game has just launched, there are lots of ways to get Bon Voyage Charms for free.

How to get Bon Voyage Charms

The easiest and quickest way right now is to play the PvP and PvPvE activities which are Singularity and Shifting Gates. There are daily limits on the rewards, but Singularity currently has a load of special first-time completion rewards that can be won to earn Bon Voyage Charms. You will also need to spend some Pinnacle Energy to play Singularity, that currency has a max of 360 and you earn 120 every day, and a run of Singularity will cost you 20 Pinnacle Energy.

You can also buy Bon Voyage Charms from a number of places. You can get them by exchanging 180 Lumia Leaves, another currency that can be earned in game, or for Translation Credits which are earned when playing Shifting Gates, and finally you can exchange Crystal Dust for them in the Fortuna shop.

As mentioned, there are lots of other ways to earn Bon Voyage charms during the launch window, including:

  • The Weekly Sign-in Bonus
  • The “Spreading Light” referral program, invite pals and earn Bon Voyage charms as they level up.
  • Character Quests
  • Primary Quests
  • Chapter Objectives
  • Primary Quests
  • Destination Exploration and Destination Reputation Rewards
  • Pre-registration rewards : If you did sign up before the game launched, you should have some Charms waiting for you when you log in.

You can keep track of many of the Rewards by going to the Events page and tapping on the Rewards Guide. You can also track Lumia Leaf rewards here, which can be turned in to Bon Voyage Charms.

How to get Bon Voyage Charms L.E.

For Bon Voyage Charms L.E. (Limited Edition) you are probably going to have to get your wallet out. These can only be used to claim characters who are available for a limited time. They can be bought via a number of methods:

  • At the Fortuna Shop where you can purchase them using Silver
  • As Rewards from the Premium Battle Pass

You can also exchange Fortuna Crystals and Fortuna Crystal dust for Bon Voyage Charms L.E. but you need rather a lot and you can only do this five times a month.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/30/destiny-rising-how-to-get-bon-voyage-charms-quickly/
